page.title: 01MYNYDD RHIW AND LOW LAND
page.content: This area is dominated by Rhiw mountain rising to three hundred and five metres. The vantage point overlooking the Lleyn peninsula and out to Barsley Island, is the site of a radar station and a radio mast. The village of Rhiw has only a post office but in the past has had a shop, garage, pub and a mine on the mountain. The welsh community is mixed with some {English}people and many of the local homes are empty for most of the year, being only used as holiday homes. Farming is the only local industry supporting dairy and beef cattle, and sheep.
